meanings.definition: The quality of being religious or spiritual.
meanings.sent1: The numinousness of the ancient temple filled me with peace.
meanings.sent2: Many find comfort in the numinousness of their faith.
meanings.sent3: The numinousness of the church made the pigeons seem like holy messengers.
meanings.sent4: Her voice had a numinousness that captivated all who heard it.
meanings.sent5: The numinousness of the starlit sky was overwhelming.

meanings.definition: The feeling of being in the presence of something greater than oneself.
meanings.sent1: In the vast cathedral, I felt a numinousness that humbled me.
meanings.sent2: The numinousness of the mountains left me in awe.
meanings.sent3: The numinousness of the towering tree made me feel like a tiny ant.
meanings.sent4: The numinousness of the ocean's power was both terrifying and beautiful.
meanings.sent5: The numinousness of the thunderstorm made me feel small and insignificant.

meanings.definition: A sense of awe or reverence.
meanings.sent1: The numinousness of the moment left us all speechless.
meanings.sent2: She gazed up at the stars with a sense of numinousness.
meanings.sent3: The numinousness of the waterfall made us all want to bow in respect.
meanings.sent4: The numinousness of the ancient ruins was palpable.
meanings.sent5: The numinousness of the sunrise filled her with wonder.
